import turtle
import datetime as dt

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor("white")

t = turtle.Turtle()
t.goto(0,10)

hr = dt.datetime.now().hour
mn = dt.datetime.now().minute
sec = dt.datetime.now().second

while True:
    t.hideturtle()
    t.clear()
    t.write(str(hr).zfill(2)+":"
    +str(mn).zfill(2)+":"
    +str(sec).zfill(2),
    font =("Arial Narrow", 35, "bold"))

    sec = dt.datetime.now().second
    mn = dt.datetime.now().minute
    hr = dt.datetime.now().hour

guide.img: In this lesson, you will learn to keep updating the time given on the screen
Let’s create a while loop, where we keep updating the time. Use the clear function to clear the screen so that the time does not get over-written on top of the other
